question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Permission Escalation] Does the test directory get created with overly permissive file modes allowing other users to read or modify test data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Information Disclosure] Do the error messages at lines 206-248 leak sensitive information about internal service implementation, file paths, or configuration that could aid attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Error Propagation] When service startup fails at line 204, does the error context properly sanitize error chains to prevent leaking Docker credentials or internal IPs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Panic Safety] If a service panics during startup, can this trigger undefined behavior in the shutdown logic, potentially corrupting Docker state or leaving orphaned processes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Shared Future Safety] Are the make_shared() wrapped futures at lines 132-133, 143, 161, 169 properly synchronized, or can concurrent access cause data races? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Clone Semantics] When shared futures are cloned (lines 138-139, 148-150, etc.), are the underlying resources properly reference-counted, or can premature cleanup cause use-after-free? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Memory Ordering] Do the Arc wrappers in make_shared() use proper memory ordering guarantees to prevent visible inconsistencies across threads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Exit Code Handling] When services exit unexpectedly at lines 220-249, are their exit codes properly validated to distinguish crashes from intentional shutdowns? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Service Restart] Can a crashed service be restarted without full cleanup, potentially causing state confusion or resource conflicts with the crashed instance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Cascading Failures] If one service fails, does this trigger a cascade of failures in dependent services, or can the system isolate the failure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Zombie Processes] When a service future completes at lines 220-249, are child processes properly reaped, or can zombie processes accumulate? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Macro: no_panic_println!] [Undefined Behavior] Can the no_panic_println! macro's error ignoring at lines 66, 95, 111, 114, etc. hide critical failures that should terminate the process? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Macro: no_panic_eprintln!] [Error Suppression] Does suppressing stderr write errors with no_panic_eprintln! at lines 72, 193, 207, 221, etc. allow attackers to hide their activities by redirecting stderr? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Type Confusion] Can the anyhow::Error type conversions at line 184-185 lose error context that's critical for security decisions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Tokio Select Bias] Do the tokio::select! blocks at lines 57-89, 108-119, 197-214, 218-250 have proper branch priorities, or can starvation occur? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Select Race] Can the tokio::select! at lines 197-214 race between shutdown.cancelled() and all_services_up, causing cleanup to run before services finish starting? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Future Cancellation] If the outer tokio::select! at lines 218-250 cancels the clean_up_all future prematurely, can this leave Docker resources in a dirty state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_command_processor()] [Stdin Blocking] Can the lines.next_line() call at line 58 block indefinitely if stdin is never closed, preventing graceful shutdown even after shutdown.cancel()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_command_processor()] [Buffer Overflow] Can extremely long input lines cause the BufReader at line 53 to allocate unbounded memory, leading to OOM crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Enum: WorkspaceCommand] [Command Injection] Can the timeout parameter (line 262) accept negative values or special values that cause undefined behavior when converted to Duration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: WorkspaceCommand::run()] [Async Soundness] Is the async run() method at line 268 properly instrumented to prevent executor poisoning if it panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Port Exhaustion] The comment at line 15 mentions 'OS-assigned ports' - can rapid service restarts exhaust available ephemeral ports causing startup failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Port Conflicts] Can two instances of the workspace server bind to the same ports if they start simultaneously, causing connection routing issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Network Stack Attack] Can an attacker on localhost exploit the services before they're fully initialized due to the parallel startup strategy? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-workspace-server/src/lib.rs] [Function: run_all_services()] [Error Context Loss] Does the .context() call at line 204 preserve all security-relevant error information from the underlying service failures? (Low)
